intro: Coinochlamys angolana, commonly known as the Angolan moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit, it is of interest to both botanists and horticulturists.
